title: Why don't You guys keep doing the journal of Justice or something cool lore related?
body: I Loved reading the lore and such about all the champions and where their from and such and i think everyone who has read it would love for you guys to keep doing it or something new.

replies.body:
People make fun of the lore-nerds but League actually had some of the most original, well-written and interesting lore of any game around. It started slipping a long time ago, a champion bio hasn't interested me in a long time and then you've got stuff like Trundle's retcon making him infinitely more dull and boring than his original rotting-corpse-as-a-sacrifice-for-his-whole-clan self. The last entry about Swain becoming Grand General was cool as hell and I still absolutely love all the Jarvan/LeBlanc speculation.

I'm not quite sure why JoJ stopped in the first place.

It's especially odd that the lore was out when they were adding a new champion every two weeks, but now we don't even get one every two months and still nothing about Journal of Justice.

I suspect, however, it has something to do with the fact that league has become less of a 'casual' players game and more into the world of e-sports and meta gameplay.

Which is sad, because I love both

Yeah i hate the trundle lore change but his new look it cool and i Think the Jarven Leblanc thing would be CRAZY and awesome if they did an event about someone finding out or like her coming out as a fake as an event or something

Oh I love new Trundle, his gameplay is much better and he looks awesome, it's only the lore I don't like.

I don't know about actually revealing the Jarv/LB thing. The huge amount of speculation and mystery is a lot of what makes the lore good. Look at all the things people have dug up from Swain and Jarvan's Judgements and whatnot. Basically every champion has some big mystery around them which, back in the JoJ days, the writers would work with and keep building on. In a game like a moba a story should never be resolved.
Yeah i Completely  agree. Love all the hidden things like garenXkatarina or the skins they made for twisted fate and eve

I disagree about Trundle's lore, solely due to the fact that he just didn't really fit in.  The reason why they changed it was because he just didn't really fit into the world, he was just in his own little world.  Now he's an integral part of the Freljord conflict.

I agree that lore is important, and I personally love it when we pull off lore well. However, I stopped reading the JoJ after just a few issues. It was just too much text with too little actual game impact. In the end of the day, the primary way in which 95% of our playerbase interacts with whatever we end up creating for Runeterra is by playing the game. That's why I think lore that ties directly into the game is so much cooler. The Freljord event and the three queens minigame (full disclosure: Meddler and I implemented the minigame, so I may be biased here) is much cooler. Or things like Lucian's login screen, Yasuo's pre-release story reveal, Jinx vandalizing Vi's champion page and so on.

I understand you lore fiends want bigger chunks of text and fiction to sink your teeth into, but I think we can do deep, complex lore without requiring people to read something which then has little to no game impact. We're always exploring new ways to do this kind of thing, so stay tuned.

Yeah, that minigame that... had nothing happen at the end of it? Or logins screen and pre-release stuff that...are basically just backstory that could get equally by reading their backstory? And Jinx's music video is not lore, it's 3 minutes of 'JINX IS CRAZY!' And I liked the music video, it was really cool, but it's not lore. Nothing happened in the video. It didn't even detail anything about Jinx that you wouldn't know by playing her or reading her quotes. 

I get that nothing is going to happen of this, and that is the exact same answer that we've been getting for years now, but please have SOMETHING happen. Like, I get that you can't really have Yi kill Singed because Singed still needs to be playable, but nothing is happening to Runeterra. The only story we get outside of champion releases are retcons and the occasional event. Just have your characters interact; in game probably isn't a good place to have this, but can't you have monthly comic strips or stories just having the champions sit around and talk about things? I'd love that. Like maybe you can say 'oh well no one reads those' but I do! I love that sort of shit! 

I think my main complaint is that every time we complain about the lack of lore we get A) 'oh but we have tons of lore, like Jinx's music video!' which I don't count as lore, just extensions of a champion release or B) 'we're setting up for future lore releases, so stay tuned!' and then they never come. Like, apparently Trundle's old story was finished so you had to change him so you can do stories with him? Okay, where are they? It's been how long now?

I don't really expect anything to change, but seriously now, you keep adding hints and changes that never amount of anything. Like, apperantly Cass has a relationship to the Shurima Desert somehow? And you retconned Anivia being from another place, so presumably Nasus and Renekton are from Shurima now. And so is Sivir. So...where's the story in all that? Why does Sivir have a rivalry with Cass? What are Nasus' and Renekton's current status? Is this ever going to get resolved? And if it's 'later', when is later? You keep setting up for a payoff that is never going to happen.

Yea, there are too many loose ends... and 0 character growth in the process.  

One of the things I REALLY want to do is for major "region" updates like the Freljord, or Shurima, would be a new map/map skin, where player actions in game turn out to effect the total event.

Big idea I had had for the Shurima event would have been a massive legendary quality map of "old" Shurima vs the Void trying to corrupt and consume it.  It would have been a dynamically altering map based on turrets & inhibs going down, and as such happens aspects of the void/"ancient divine" Shurima push out in each lane.   Full endgame where a large chunk of the structures have been KOed it would be heavily corrupted for each side.  Imagine when you took out the mid lane tower on the "old" side the nearby large rock would fall into a tear in the world into the void, ect.

During the event, the map would automatically replace the "vanilla" SR map, and after the event it would be a map skin you can use.  Furthermore, based on the entire event (which team won more often) certain skins would be released like Void Xerath if the Void won, or Ascendant Nasus if Shurima won, for example.  You could even do lore growths of characters like Sivir (based on whichever side she won most on she would have her lore updated to reflect, as well as a skin related to the side) where "her" choice on what side she backed (Did she do it for the money and/or power for the Void?  Or did her honor take hold and she helped to fight it off even without promise of pay?).


It would require almost every part of production Riot has to pull it off, but boy would it be epic.

> but can't you have monthly comic strips or stories just having the champions sit around and talk about things?

See Dawngate. Literally both of these things. Repeatedly. Best lore in a MOBA I've seen since the JoJ days. People LOVE the stories and comic Dawngate is doing. But Riot is in that Blizzard-esque stage of being large enough to say "We know what you want better than you do so just trust us!"

God I love how dawngate took their lore. 

I would love nothing more then if League did that.
WELL it did have tibbers teddy bears in the video. I think everyone was so deeply enchated by jinx's awesomeness to even notice. It also showed how true jinx was having fun.

How is that even relevant to Lore whatsoever? It gives no background nor anything, for all we know Jinx went to the bathroom and Tibbers is sitting there.

That's what you'd call a Cameo.
"Yay. Lore"

Unfortunately, that's all background character information, not "lore."

Let's take two characters, call them "Hero" and "Villain."

"Hero" is a reformed criminal now pursuing justice with an inside knowledge of how crime works.  "Villain" is a crazy young woman with a penchant for combining practical jokes and murder.  Now, give "Hero" a pair of oversized punching gauntlets, a really cool pink hairstyle and a punk rock attitude and theme song while you give "Villain" an awesome music video showing her having fun through reckless abandonment and absolute mayhem with three guns.

What you have, despite the awesome nature of the products and the hard work of the creators, is a different version of each champion's background information.

Same with the Shadow Isles/Twisted Treeline changes (which are still incomplete since Evelynn's interactions with the alter spirits are not impements NOR is her story included in the thing) as well as the Freljord conflict.

You only get "lore" when conflicts develop, both on a global scale .  That was what the Journal of Justice did.  It gave extra information about relationships between champions and developed interesting avenues, like Garen's possible relationship with Katarina and Gragas' growth from hillbilly to businessman.

If Riot ***can*** deliver on providing deep, complex lore without using "bigger chunks of text," I look forward to seeing it, but I don't expect it anytime soon, Soonâ„¢, or within my lifetime.

> I understand you lore fiends want bigger chunks of text and fiction to sink your teeth into, but I think we can do deep, complex lore without requiring people to read something which then has little to no game impact. We're always exploring new ways to do this kind of thing, so stay tuned.

Sorry, I find it highly unlikely you can tell a deep complex lore story without some form of reading or visual storytelling. Imo the things you listed are neat but not deep lore items, the Freljord event was ok but how much lore did we really learn? Not a whole lot. 

Lucian's log in screen was at least a lore teaser but unfortunately it was just that a teaser trailer. Jinx's Music Video was awesome but not chock full of lore, chock full of music and gun play for sure and that is fun but not much for a compelling story.

The other events lately have all been similarly lacking in depth. I believe that to tell a good story, which is basically what lore is. You are going to have to tell a good story, in text, visually, or whatever other ways you can find. I highly doubt much lore will ever have a large impact in game no matter how it is presented.
With all this lore talk it wonders me: will league of legends get a movie? That would be totally epic.

Definitely not as long as Riot thinks that the community can't handle paying attention long enough to read a few paragraphs. I mean if we can't be expected to read a few paragraphs then how could we sit and watch a movie?

> I agree that lore is important, and I personally love it when we pull off lore well. However, I stopped reading the JoJ after just a few issues. It was just too much text with too little actual game impact. In the end of the day, the primary way in which 95% of our playerbase interacts with whatever we end up creating for Runeterra is by playing the game. That's why I think lore that ties directly into the game is so much cooler. The Freljord event and the three queens minigame (full disclosure: Meddler and I implemented the minigame, so I may be biased here) is much cooler. Or things like Lucian's login screen, Yasuo's pre-release story reveal, Jinx vandalizing Vi's champion page and so on.
> 
> I understand you lore fiends want bigger chunks of text and fiction to sink your teeth into, but I think we can do deep, complex lore without requiring people to read something which then has little to no game impact. We're always exploring new ways to do this kind of thing, so stay tuned.

It's almost like people have been telling you that this isn't what they want, or how they see things for four years or more. But we're still just gettin' various versions of this post. But surely you guys know better than the people who have been ultra patient with you for years, and all those people who aren't remotely satisfied with your approach. I'm sure you'll read this and immediately the first response will be the trained response/fallacy of 'But the forums are a vocal minority!' which would be slammed with a hammer in a real discussion. 

I shudder to think about what your opinions on actual literature are.
Who remembers the Ionia Vs. Noxus Match? Let's get some more of that going!

I would loooove a feature game mode where you chose a side in some sort of conflict and played champions only from each respective side. Demacia vs. Noxus anyone?

rito plz
That'd be so cool
+1 for the coolness
http://leaguefactions.net/ - This has already been set up by CupcakeTrap for some time. Anybody interested in this further can contact him or sign up on the site.
That would be an {{champion:39}} buff.
Short lore animatics would be amazing

LoLcrafts.

Carboot plz.

Saw this thread and just had to comment on it. It's actually something that I've been wondering for a bit... I've only been playing this game since late season three, and all I ever knew was the PvP in it with slight backstories to the characters and the JoJ which disappeared before I could finish reading it. However, I recently stumbled upon a few threads of the past while looking into things like the shopkeeper in ARAM and I'm astonished to see just how much lore and work was put into the game. The evolution vs the resistance seemed so fun and skins even had much more meaning-- once I learned that and saw how involved the community used to be I was completely taken aback. I thought this game was basically pvp and story was a sideshow. 
But as I read more about rivals and character interactions... I just got sad. I feel like I missed out on something truly amazing; like it all just disappeared. I really hope I get the opportunity to see progress in the story behind the League of Legends and get to choose a side like i did with the Frejlord event. I noticed some champion lore doesn't even mention why the champion even joined the league(ie: Jinx)so I hope it isn't really fading away. If it is, I'm seriously disappointed in myself for not giving this game a chance sooner.I know you guys are really busy and have alot to handle, but with the deletion of the JoJ I'm just wondering... is the lore from LoL really fading away? Or do you have your own plans to bring it back? Is there going to be an attempt to bring it back in a way newer players can understand?
I think alot of people would be lured to your game if they knew the story behind it, and I think that the reason alot of older players left is because the lore did. Though this comment will probably go unnoticed, I thought it'd be worth a shot to try to get a response.
Honestly, the LoL matches are supposed to be about a certain event happening in Valoran that was resolved with the match, i would like to see more of that D:
Part of why I started playing League was for the lore, and I especially love reading those things about a champion's entry into the League of Legends.

The thing that hooked me up to League, is the story(lore) behind each champion and their interaction. It'd be awesome if we could have something more like the Freljord event. Riot should start revealing the world of Runeterra. .

How about the interaction between these three {{champion:89}}-  {{champion:80}} - {{champion:131}} ?
Riot "left" their conflict and just carried on with other stuff.
I can tell you why. I thought the reason was obvious : It doesn't make money.

let me tell how it can be linked to riot making money:
1. Player signs up for lol about hearing about lores
2. Player plays games
3. Player hears about skins
4. Player sees skin and relizes there awesome.
5. Player buys skins and contiues playing and reading lores.
Skins cost money. Boom

Moreover, lore-based skins are incredibly cool. Who else was psyched that when Swain became Military General of Noxus, he got the Tyrant Swain skin?

People care about the lore, major lore event shakes up the world of Runeterra, skin is made based on what happened to the characters in the lore.

And then you just print money.

Or just make more skins. Boom money, in 1 easy step, no need to go trough the gamble that people will start playing league because of lore. Now, I like lol's lore, i used to read JoJ aswell, but you have to open your eyes : Riot is growing more and more greedy for money.

Oh, also, most skins shouldn't exist according to the lore.
And how does that make sense (besides {{champion:48}} )

I love the lore of league and the journals, I want to know more about demacia and noxus, zuan and piltover (sorry for grammer). Hec what about {{champion:112}} battlecast army? There's got to be stuff going on in runeterra.

I love all the lore stuff in league. I've read every champions lore and wish i could find a little bit more about certain champs or at least a little more detail about Runeterra. Would love to know more about the shadow isles or the howling abyss!

There is a lot of cool lore if you go back and research older champions. Everyone had intertwining stories and events in Runeterra actually progressed regularly instead of getting 1 tiny thing every 2 months.
Yes. Give this man a medal

As of now this thread has 496 yes to 19 no votes. That is a ridiculous majority, Zenon that I don't  think you can ignore. If you don't bring back the JoJ in it's previous form maybe you can do small weekly snippets of lore or monthly ones. You may think you know what we want in this case but frankly you don't or Riot chooses to ignore the majority.

{{champion:126}} -"Viktor I will stop you"

{{champion:112}} -"No you won't because Riot does care what happens between us"
Yeah what the eff Riot, wheres my damn lore. WHAT IS MCSWAIN DOING IN NOXUS, ALL RULING AND STUFF!

I'm sorry, seeing this, I had to jump in. I love the lore to, and I loved JoJ. I mean, it gave us tidbits we NEVER see in game, the lives of champs when they're not on the Rift, what they do in their spare time, etc. etc. 

I also loved the Freljord event, but I feel like it was so temporary. When it came out, I thought "so, these 3 are going to be stuck fighting forever?"

I've been playing this game since early Season 2 and I've read every single champion bio and those who had their own Judgements. Nowadays, I feel like we've been severely lacking in the lore department. Look at the bios of the champs since pre-season 3. We, the Summoners, the ones who are also part of the world, have been dropped. There's no more mention of the League of Legends, no more mention of the Institute of War, and no mention of us. The reworked champs (Sejuani is the first to come to mind) had their lines rewritten not to mention the Summoners. So...the champs don't interact with us anymore? I loved that the players were made part of the lore, that made the game all the more immersive.

Another thing I'd like to point out is that a lot of the champs are not given a reason to join the League. It had always intrigued me as to why a champ would land himself in the League. Why is Syndra in the League? Did the Summoners capture her and coerce her to participate to prevent her from screwing up Ionia? Why is Jinx in the League? Did they catch her too or did she join because she felt like it? 

I would like to see what's going on in Runeterra. How is Swain ruling Noxus? Is Demacia going to kick their asses soon? Does Morgana still have her bakery? Will any of the Three Sisters win and finally rule Freljord? Will Diana and Leona work out their differences? I want to see charcter development and not just stop with champs interacting with one another? Because seriously, are they going to keep doing that forever?   

Come on, Riot, you gave us the Ionia vs. Noxus match. You've proven that you can write and give us the most interesting lore so why, why, why are you stifling yourselves? What's wrong with reading news about Runeterra? What's wrong with doing what you're doing now but giving us something to read on the side? We are still part of this world that you've created, right? Unless you've retconned us, the Summoners, out of Runeterra. Doesn't it make sense that we Summoners get daily updates on the goings-on in the city states? What is happening to Runeterra right now? It's been a stand-still for 2 years except for the events that have not been resolved. 

I believe you can still wow us with excellent lore, Riot. Let us in the lives of the Champions again, let us live in Runeterra again.

Hears a lore a reason y lores r importen to game play: VI, jinx, and cait have a passive called "catch me if u can" Jinx gets bonse gold if she kills or assits on cait or vi and vi and cait the same for jinx
**{{champion:119}} **
12 people are stupid

I have to corrrect (intentional mispelling) the person who wrote that the writers for the lore behind the characters and fantasy  world were well written. I could have pointed out errors in grammar and spelling in those excerpts, but the story remained very interesting.

totally miss it!!

more story needed to explain a lot of stuff
